entry.title: Incoming season changes bring new fruits and veggies
entry.summary: The sun sets earlier than it did last month and the morning chill remains for a bit longer as August ends and September brings the fall season. As the weather changes, farmers switch over to the fall crops.

entry.summary: GREEN — A structure fire on Sunburst Court in the Green District was contained to the garage just after 4 p.m. Tuesday.

entry.title: Structure Fire on Stonewood Court in Green
entry.summary: At 4:08 on Tuesday afternoon, crews from Central Douglas Fire & Rescue were dispatched to a reported structure fire on Sunburst Court off of Ryland Drive in the Green District. Initial reports indicated that the garage was on fire and the house was filling with smoke. Thanks to the efficient response of our firefighters, the fire was contained to the garage and did not extend to the living quarters of the residence. Although the garage suffered significant damage, the most important thing to note is that the occupants and their pets were able to get out of the structure safely. No injuries were reported by the residents or the firefighters working the scene. CDF&R responded to this incident with three fire engines and two command units, totaling 12 personnel. Due to the heavy fire damage, crews could not determine the cause of the fire. PP&L assisted crews at the scene. The Red Cross was notified and assisted the occupants of the home. # # #

entry.title: Deputies investigate threat at Douglas County Courthouse
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Douglas County Courthouse and Justice Building closed early Tuesday due to a threat.

entry.title: Deputies Investigate Unfounded Threat at Douglas County Courthouse
entry.summary: ROSEBURG, Ore. - On Tuesday, August 27, 2024, shortly before the end of the business day, the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office investigated a reported threat at the Douglas County Courthouse and Justice Building Complex. Out of an abundance of caution and in coordination with County Officials, the Courthouse and Justice Buildings were closed early, and all occupants were sent home for the day. The incident has since been determined to not be credible and remains under further investigation. The Courthouse and Justice Building complex will re-open tomorrow, Wednesday, August 28, 2024, at its normal time and all business will resume as normal. No further information will be released at this time.

entry.title: DEMOCRATIC PARTY HAS FLEGEL BANQUET & AUCTION
entry.summary: August 27, 2024 2:50 a.m. The Democratic Party of Douglas County will have its 37th annual Flegel Banquet & Auction on Saturday, September 14th. The event will be held at the Douglas County Fairgrounds from 5:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. The keynote speaker is State Senator Jeff Golden. The evening includes dinner and an opportunity...
